questions.text: Based on the features observed in the diagram, which of the following organisms does this life cycle most likely belong to?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Entamoeba histolytica

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Life cycle of E. histolytica - Ingestion of quadri-nucleated cyst → develops to trophozoites →multiply in large intestine → develops to precyst → cyst (immature) → quadri-nucleated cyst (mature) passes in stool.
  • ➤ Life cycle of E. histolytica -
  • ➤ Ingestion of quadri-nucleated cyst → develops to trophozoites →multiply in large intestine → develops to precyst → cyst (immature) → quadri-nucleated cyst (mature) passes in stool.

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy tripped while running in a playground, sustained lacerations at the base of his thumb from a broken glass bottle. Examination revealed that he could not oppose his thumb to his fingers, and there was weakness in thumb abduction and flexion. No sensory deficits were noted. Which nerve was most likely injured?

options.label: A
options.text: Superficial palmar branch of median nerve

questions.correct_answer: B. Recurrent branch of median nerve
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The recurrent branch of the median nerve is critical for thumb movements including opposition, abduction, and flexion. Injury to this nerve results in characteristic deficits of these thumb functions without affecting sensation, highlighting its importance in thumb motor control.
  • ➤ The recurrent branch of the median nerve is critical for thumb movements including opposition, abduction, and flexion.
  • ➤ Injury to this nerve results in characteristic deficits of these thumb functions without affecting sensation, highlighting its importance in thumb motor control.

questions.text: In a routine screening for intestinal parasites at a rural clinic near Pune, a medical technician uses a saturated salt solution floatation method to analyze stool samples. This technique is utilized to detect various helminthic eggs by exploiting differences in their buoyancy. One particular type of egg, however, is known not to float in this solution due to its higher density. Which of the following helminthic eggs is least likely to float in a saturated salt solution?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Eggs of Taenia solium

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Eggs of all the following helminthic worms float in a saturated salt solution EXCEPT - ULTO - U nfertilized eggs of Ascaris, L arva of Strongyloides, T aenia eggs and O perculated eggs of trematodes
  • ➤ Eggs of all the following helminthic worms float in a saturated salt solution EXCEPT -
  • ➤ ULTO - U nfertilized eggs of Ascaris, L arva of Strongyloides, T aenia eggs and O perculated eggs of trematodes
  • ➤ ULTO
  • ➤ U
  • ➤ L
  • ➤ T
  • ➤ O

questions.text: A patient suffering from acute respiratory distress following CABG for coronary artery disease is being prepared for mechanical ventilation. Which of the following statements about lung protective ventilatory settings is NOT true?

options.label: A
options.text: Tidal volume should be set at 4-6 ml/kg of ideal body weight (IBW).

options.label: B
options.text: Respiratory rate should be initially set at 12-16 breaths per minute.

options.label: C
options.text: Initial FiO2 should be set at 100% and reduced as tolerated to avoid oxygen toxicity.

options.label: D
options.text: PEEP should be set at 5 cm H2O and not adjusted.

questions.correct_answer: D. PEEP should be set at 5 cm H2O and not adjusted.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) PEEP should be set at 5 cm H2O and not adjusted

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A. Tidal volume should be set at 4-6 ml/kg of ideal body weight (IBW) : True. The recommended initial tidal volume for mechanical ventilation is 4-6 ml/kg based on the patient’s ideal body weight to prevent barotrauma and volutrauma.
  • • Option A. Tidal volume should be set at 4-6 ml/kg of ideal body weight (IBW)
  • • Option B. Respiratory rate should be initially set at 12-16 breaths per minute: True. A respiratory rate of 12 to 16 breaths per minute is a common initial setting which can be adjusted based on the patient's gas exchange and acid-base status.
  • • Option B.
  • • Respiratory rate should be initially set at 12-16 breaths per minute:
  • • Option C. Initial FiO2 should be set at 100% and reduced as tolerated to avoid oxygen toxicity: True. Starting with an FiO2 of 100% is a typical approach in critically ill patients to ensure adequate oxygenation. The FiO2 is usually titrated down to avoid oxygen toxicity, depending on arterial blood gases and oxygen saturation.
  • • Option C.
  • • Initial FiO2 should be set at 100% and reduced as tolerated to avoid oxygen toxicity:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When initiating mechanical ventilation, it is critical to start with safe settings tailored to the patient’s lung mechanics and underlying pathology. The initial PEEP setting should be low but requires careful adjustment, to balance lung recruitment and cardiac output.
  • ➤ When initiating mechanical ventilation, it is critical to start with safe settings tailored to the patient’s lung mechanics and underlying pathology.
  • ➤ The initial PEEP setting should be low but requires careful adjustment, to balance lung recruitment and cardiac output.

questions.text: A 36-year-old woman in her first pregnancy is at her 8-week prenatal visit. She expresses concern about the risk of Down syndrome, noting her understanding that increased maternal age can elevate risk. Which of the following prenatal screening tests should be recommended to this patient for the highest detection rate of Down syndrome?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a woman of advanced maternal age seeking the screening test with the highest detection rate for Down syndrome, cell-free DNA screening is the most effective and least invasive option currently available, making it the recommended choice.
  • ➤ For a woman of advanced maternal age seeking the screening test with the highest detection rate for Down syndrome, cell-free DNA screening is the most effective and least invasive option currently available, making it the recommended choice.

questions.text: Dr. Iyer is conducting a study to assess the effectiveness of a new diabetes management program in a suburban area of India. She collects mortality data for patients with diabetes both before and after the implementation of the program. To ensure the validity of her comparisons given the different age structures of the populations at different times, she decides to use an epidemiological tool that adjusts mortality rates to a standard age distribution. The following data is provided: Observed deaths in the suburban area post-program implementation: 120 Expected deaths based on a standard age distribution, had the program not been implemented: 160 Calculate the Standardized Mortality Ratio (SMR) for the suburban area following the program implementation and determine what it suggests about the effectiveness of the program.

options.label: A
options.text: 0.75, suggesting the program was effective in reducing mortality

options.label: C
options.text: 1.00, suggesting the program had no effect on mortality

options.label: D
options.text: 0.50, suggesting a significant reduction in mortality

questions.correct_answer: A. 0.75, suggesting the program was effective in reducing mortality
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 0.75, suggesting the program was effective in reducing mortality

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Indirect standardization: Standardized mortality ratio (SMR): Is simplest and most useful form Method: Calculate expected deaths, assuming that study group experiences the death rates of a standard population.
  • ➤ Indirect standardization: Standardized mortality ratio (SMR): Is simplest and most useful form
  • ➤ Method: Calculate expected deaths, assuming that study group experiences the death rates of a standard population.

questions.text: A physician suspects a patient has impaired bile pigment excretion due to liver dysfunction. Which of the following tests should be employed to assess the presence of bile salts in the patient's urine?
questions.explanation: Ans.

questions.text: All of the following are examples of Dermal melanocytosis Ceruloderma except?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Becker's nevus is not classified as a form of dermal melanocytosis Ceruloderma but rather as a hamartoma involving epidermal and connective tissue elements. This distinction is important for accurate diagnosis and understanding of the condition’s etiology and management.
  • ➤ Becker's nevus is not classified as a form of dermal melanocytosis Ceruloderma but rather as a hamartoma involving epidermal and connective tissue elements.
  • ➤ This distinction is important for accurate diagnosis and understanding of the condition’s etiology and management.

questions.text: Match the following descriptions of paraphilic disorders with their respective terms: Descriptions: A 35-year-old man derived sexual excitement and gratification from making obscene telephone calls to unknown women. A 28-year-old woman reported to the emergency department explaining that she experiences sexual arousal from the administration of enemas, which she performs on herself regularly. A 40-year-old man, during his psychiatric evaluation, expressed that he obtains sexual pleasure from the sight of feces. A 42-year-old man is being assessed for episodes during which he uses obscene language to obtain sexual excitement in public places. Terms: A. Caprolalia B. Scatalogia C. Coprophilia D. Klismaphilia
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 1-B, 2-D, 3-C, 4-A

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Caprolalia involves obtaining sexual excitement through the use of obscene language. Scatalogia is associated with making obscene telephone calls, often to strangers. Coprophilia refers to sexual gratification derived from the sight or interaction with feces. Klismaphilia involves sexual arousal from the administration of enemas.
  • • Caprolalia involves obtaining sexual excitement through the use of obscene language.
  • • Scatalogia is associated with making obscene telephone calls, often to strangers.
  • • Coprophilia refers to sexual gratification derived from the sight or interaction with feces.
  • • Klismaphilia involves sexual arousal from the administration of enemas.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Some additional terminologies -

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient presents with hearing loss and occasional ear discharge. Otoscopic examination shows retraction of the pars flaccida of the tympanic membrane. Based on the staging of the retraction of pars flaccida shown in the image, what is the likely stage of this patient if the examination reveals a deep retraction pocket with adherent malleus, but without ossicular erosion?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Type III

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Identify Type III pars flaccida retraction as characterized by a deep retraction pocket with malleus adhesion but no ossicular erosion.
  • ➤ Identify Type III pars flaccida retraction as characterized by a deep retraction pocket with malleus adhesion but no ossicular erosion.

questions.text: A 43-year-old female patient visits a healthcare center in Delhi with complaints of recurrent urinary tract infections. The microbiology lab receives a urine sample for analysis. To determine the specific characteristics of the bacterial strain involved, the laboratory technician decides to use Craigie's tube method. Given this information, what does Craigie’s tube method differentiate between?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Motile and nonmotile strains

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Craigie’s tube method is specifically utilized to distinguish between motile and nonmotile bacterial strains. This differentiation is crucial in the identification and characterization of pathogens in clinical microbiology, aiding in the diagnosis and treatment of infections.
  • ➤ Craigie’s tube method is specifically utilized to distinguish between motile and nonmotile bacterial strains.
  • ➤ This differentiation is crucial in the identification and characterization of pathogens in clinical microbiology, aiding in the diagnosis and treatment of infections.

questions.text: Consider the following statements: Statement 1: Risk of relapse of bipolar disorder is higher in postpartum period compared to pregnancy. Statement 2: Lithium is the most teratogenic mood stabilizer. Statement 3: Valproate use in pregnancy is associated with Ebstein’s anomaly in the baby. Statement 4: Antipsychotics are less teratogenic and more effective for management of bipolar disorder in pregnancy. Which of the following is correct?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Statements 1 and 4 are correct.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 65-year-old male with a history of hypertension and smoking presents to the emergency department complaining of sudden, severe chest pain radiating to his back. The pain is described as tearing in nature. His blood pressure is 170/100 mmHg. A CT scan is performed and the image is provided below. Given the clinical history and radiographic findings, which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When a patient present with sudden, severe, tearing chest pain radiating to the back, particularly with risk factors such as hypertension and a history of smoking, a thoracic aortic aneurysm should be highly suspected. CT imaging showing aortic dilation is critical for diagnosis and immediate management to prevent catastrophic outcomes like aortic rupture.
  • ➤ When a patient present with sudden, severe, tearing chest pain radiating to the back, particularly with risk factors such as hypertension and a history of smoking, a thoracic aortic aneurysm should be highly suspected.
  • ➤ CT imaging showing aortic dilation is critical for diagnosis and immediate management to prevent catastrophic outcomes like aortic rupture.

questions.text: A middle aged man presented to the emergency department with chest pain. His angiogram revealed active bleeding from a vein that runs alongside the left anterior descending (LAD) artery. Which vein is most likely affected ?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Understanding the anatomical course of the great cardiac vein in relation to the left anterior descending artery is crucial for diagnosing vascular injuries in this area. This knowledge is vital during interventions involving the LAD, where inadvertent damage to the great cardiac vein can result in significant complications.
  • ➤ Understanding the anatomical course of the great cardiac vein in relation to the left anterior descending artery is crucial for diagnosing vascular injuries in this area.
  • ➤ This knowledge is vital during interventions involving the LAD, where inadvertent damage to the great cardiac vein can result in significant complications.

questions.text: Match each device listed in Column A with the maximum FiO2 it delivers, as shown in Column B. Column A: 1. High Flow Nasal Cannula (HFNC) 2. Non-Rebreather Mask (NRBM) 3. Hudson Mask 4. Nasal Cannula at 3 L/min Oxygen Flow Column B: a. 30-35% Fio2 b. 90% -100 % FiO2 c. Up to 80% FiO2 d. 40-60% FiO2
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 1-b 2-c 3-d 4-a

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • High Flow Nasal Cannula (HFNC) can deliver up to 100 % FiO2 depending on the device settings and patient's inspiratory flow rate, offering a high level of oxygen delivery and humidification.
  • • High Flow Nasal Cannula (HFNC)
  • • Non-Rebreather Mask (NRBM) provides up to 80% FiO2 when properly fitted and the reservoir bag is kept inflated, ensuring a high concentration of oxygen is available for the patient.
  • • Non-Rebreather Mask (NRBM)
  • • Hudson Mask , also known as a simple mask, can deliver FiO2 levels between 40-60% based on the oxygen flow rate.
  • • Hudson Mask
  • • Nasal Cannula at 3 L/min Oxygen Flow typically provides 32% FiO2, making it suitable for patients requiring low to moderate additional oxygen.
  • • Nasal Cannula at 3 L/min Oxygen Flow

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oxygen delivery devices are an essential aspect of managing patients with respiratory distress or hypoxemia.
  • ➤ Oxygen delivery devices are an essential aspect of managing patients with respiratory distress or hypoxemia.

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman with a history of endometriosis and tubal surgery is considering in vitro fertilization and is also interested in using an intrauterine device for contraception. She is concerned about her risk for ectopic pregnancy. Which factor most significantly increases this patient's risk for an ectopic pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For women with a history of tubal surgery, the risk of an ectopic pregnancy is notably higher, making it a critical factor to consider in pregnancy planning and contraception decisions.
  • ➤ For women with a history of tubal surgery, the risk of an ectopic pregnancy is notably higher, making it a critical factor to consider in pregnancy planning and contraception decisions.

questions.text: Two social workers are evaluating the needs of families for a community support program in a suburban area. They assessed 60 families to decide if they require additional social services. The results are as follows: Both social workers agreed that 22 families require additional services. Both agreed that 28 families do not require additional services. Social worker A assessed that 35 families require services and 25 do not. Social worker B assessed that 40 families require services and 20 do not. Calculate the Kappa statistic to determine the level of agreement between the two social workers regarding the need for additional services for these families.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 0.66

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Kappa Interpretation: 0 = agreement equivalent to chance. 0 – 0.20 = slight agreement. 0.21 – 0.40 = fair agreement. 0.41 – 0.60 = moderate agreement. 0.61 – 0.80 = substantial agreement. 0.81 – 0.99 = near perfect agreement 1 = perfect agreement.
  • ➤ Kappa Interpretation: 0 = agreement equivalent to chance. 0 – 0.20 = slight agreement. 0.21 – 0.40 = fair agreement. 0.41 – 0.60 = moderate agreement. 0.61 – 0.80 = substantial agreement. 0.81 – 0.99 = near perfect agreement 1 = perfect agreement.
  • ➤ 0 = agreement equivalent to chance. 0 – 0.20 = slight agreement. 0.21 – 0.40 = fair agreement. 0.41 – 0.60 = moderate agreement. 0.61 – 0.80 = substantial agreement. 0.81 – 0.99 = near perfect agreement 1 = perfect agreement.
  • ➤ 0 = agreement equivalent to chance.
  • ➤ 0 – 0.20 = slight agreement.
  • ➤ 0.21 – 0.40 = fair agreement.
  • ➤ 0.41 – 0.60 = moderate agreement.
  • ➤ 0.61 – 0.80 = substantial agreement.
  • ➤ 0.81 – 0.99 = near perfect agreement
  • ➤ 1 = perfect agreement.

questions.text: You as an intern, are accompanying your Dermatology senior resident for reference of a 2-week-old neonate in paediatric ward with the following skin finding. You diagnose it as a disorder of Eccrine glands, which the Senior Resident in derma also accepts. At what level does the obstruction occur in this condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Miliaria crystallina is a disorder resulting from the obstruction of eccrine sweat ducts at the level of the stratum corneum. Recognizing the characteristic clear vesicles can help diagnose the condition and manage it appropriately, typically by reducing heat exposure and improving skin ventilation to resolve the symptoms.
  • ➤ Miliaria crystallina is a disorder resulting from the obstruction of eccrine sweat ducts at the level of the stratum corneum.
  • ➤ Recognizing the characteristic clear vesicles can help diagnose the condition and manage it appropriately, typically by reducing heat exposure and improving skin ventilation to resolve the symptoms.

questions.text: During a labor and delivery training session, medical students are learning about tools for fetal monitoring. An instructor shows an image of a device used to directly monitor fetal heart rate during labor. Identify the device?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fetal scalp electrodes are essential in providing accurate, real-time data on fetal heart rate during labor, especially in scenarios where external monitors fail to capture clear, consistent readings.

questions.text: Dr. Mehta is managing a community health initiative to evaluate renal function in a rural district in India. As part of this initiative, GFR was measured in a group of 100 individuals. The average GFR recorded was 85 ml/min, with a standard deviation of 25 ml/min. To assess the reliability of these measurements and provide data for policymaking, Dr. Mehta decides to calculate the 90% confidence interval for the mean GFR. What is this interval?
questions.explanation:
Ans.  C) 81-89 ml/min

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Confidence intervals
  • ➤ A confidence interval gives an estimated range of values which is likely to include an unknown population parameter, the estimated range being calculated from a given set of sample data Confidence Intervals (CI) = Mean ± Z (Standard error), where ‘Z’ is the Critical value for the given CI, and SE = SD/√n (SD Standard deviatio n, n = Sample size)
  • ➤ A confidence interval gives an estimated range of values which is likely to include an unknown population parameter, the estimated range being calculated from a given set of sample data
  • ➤ Confidence Intervals (CI) = Mean ± Z (Standard error), where ‘Z’ is the Critical value for the given CI, and SE = SD/√n (SD Standard deviatio n, n = Sample size)
  • ➤ Critical value for 90% Confidence level (Z68) = 1.0 Critical value for 90% Confidence level (Z90) = 1.645 Critical value for 95% Confidence level (Z95) = 1.96 Critical value for 98% Confidence level (Z98) = 2.33 Critical value for 99% Confidence level (Z99) = 2.575
  • ➤ Critical value for 90% Confidence level (Z68) = 1.0
  • ➤ Critical value for 90% Confidence level (Z90) = 1.645
  • ➤ Critical value for 95% Confidence level (Z95) = 1.96
  • ➤ Critical value for 98% Confidence level (Z98) = 2.33
  • ➤ Critical value for 99% Confidence level (Z99) = 2.575

These symptoms have been present for more than six weeks. He reports difficulty concentrating at work and disrupted sleep patterns. Given the duration and nature of his symptoms, which of the following statements is true?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Most individuals with this condition seek treatment within the first year of symptoms appearing.

options.label: C
options.text: The lifetime prevalence of this disorder is higher in women than in men.

options.label: D
options.text: It is most prevalent among individuals in their late 50s and early 60s.

Female: Male prevalence = 2:1 More common in separated, divorced or widowed than married individuals. Female: Male prevalence = 2:1 More common in separated, divorced or widowed than married individuals. Amongst psychiatric disorders, depression is associated with maximum DALYs (disability-adjusted life years) Depression is the most common cause of suicide. Suicide rate in depression - 10-15%
  • ➤ According to National Mental Health Study (NMHS-2016), carried out by NIMHANS, depression is the most common mental illness in India (excluding tobacco use disorders) Most common age of onset is middle-age, and the mean age of onset is 40 years, prevalence is increasing in young people too. Female: Male prevalence = 2:1 More common in separated, divorced or widowed than married individuals. Amongst psychiatric disorders, depression is associated with maximum DALYs (disability-adjusted life years) Depression is the most common cause of suicide. Suicide rate in depression - 10-15%
  • ➤ According to National Mental Health Study (NMHS-2016), carried out by NIMHANS, depression is the most common mental illness in India (excluding tobacco use disorders)

questions.text: During a prenatal class at a community health center, an obstetrician explains the stages of labor to medical students. The discussion focuses on the mechanisms of labor, particularly how the fetal head moves through the birth canal. The obstetrician emphasizes the importance of specific fetal head movements necessary for a safe and successful delivery. Which movement of the fetal head is essential as a prerequisite for its descent during labor?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Flexion of the fetal head is a critical initial movement in labor, allowing the head to engage in the pelvis in the most favorable position for descent, which is key to progressing through the stages of labor effectively.
  • ➤ Flexion of the fetal head is a critical initial movement in labor, allowing the head to engage in the pelvis in the most favorable position for descent, which is key to progressing through the stages of labor effectively.

questions.text: Dr. Sharma is reviewing the results of a recently concluded randomized trial conducted in Telangana, comparing the efficacy of two antihypertensive drugs. Although the trial results indicated a statistically significant difference in efficacy between the two drugs with a p-value of <0.005, subsequent studies and a meta-analysis have confirmed that there is no actual difference in efficacy between them. This scenario is an example of which type of statistical error?
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Type I error (alpha error)

questions.text: Which structure should be incised to safely access the omental bursa while protecting the structures entering the porta hepatitis and the blood vessels supplying the stomach?
questions.correct_answer: B. Hepatoduodenal portion of lesser omentum
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Selecting the hepatoduodenal portion of the lesser omentum for incision during surgical approaches to the omental bursa is critical for avoiding damage to key vascular and structural components in the upper abdomen. This choice is crucial for successful surgical outcomes and patient safety during complex abdominal procedures.
  • ➤ Selecting the hepatoduodenal portion of the lesser omentum for incision during surgical approaches to the omental bursa is critical for avoiding damage to key vascular and structural components in the upper abdomen.
  • ➤ This choice is crucial for successful surgical outcomes and patient safety during complex abdominal procedures.

questions.text: A 31-year-old woman, G4, is in active labor at 37 weeks’ gestation. During labor management, the obstetrician performs an amniotomy to accelerate labor when the cervix is dilated to 5 cm. Upon rupture of the membranes, the amniotic fluid appears to be a golden color. What is the most likely cause of the golden coloration of the amniotic fluid observed after amniotomy in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rh isoimmunization is a serious condition that can cause fetal anemia, jaundice, and even hydrops fetalis, reflected in the altered color of the amniotic fluid. It underscores the importance of Rh factor compatibility testing and appropriate management throughout pregnancy to prevent hemolytic disease of the fetus and newborn.
  • ➤ Rh isoimmunization is a serious condition that can cause fetal anemia, jaundice, and even hydrops fetalis, reflected in the altered color of the amniotic fluid.
  • ➤ It underscores the importance of Rh factor compatibility testing and appropriate management throughout pregnancy to prevent hemolytic disease of the fetus and newborn.

questions.text: Dr. Kaur, a public health official from Uttarakhand, is analysing the relationship between infant mortality rate (IMR) and economic status across various districts. The data includes IMR and economic indicators such as income levels and employment rates. She hypothesizes that as economic status improves, IMR should decrease. Which of the following correlation coefficients would most likely represent the relationship between IMR and economic status in her study?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) r = –0.8

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A correlation coefficient closes to -1 indicates a strong inverse relationship, essential for public health planning and interventions to improve health equity.
  • ➤ A correlation coefficient closes to -1 indicates a strong inverse relationship, essential for public health planning and interventions to improve health equity.

questions.text: A neurology resident is taking seminar on neuromuscular anatomy with interns, focusing on muscles with dual nerve supplies. The session explores the implications of dual nerve supply in muscle function and surgical planning. Which of the following muscles is only supplied by a single nerve, lacking dual innervation?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The pronator teres muscle’s singular innervation by the median nerve is critical for its function in forearm pronation.
  • ➤ The pronator teres muscle’s singular innervation by the median nerve is critical for its function in forearm pronation.

questions.text: A 33-year-old woman, who has just given birth to her second child, consults with her obstetrician during a postpartum visit. She is breastfeeding and seeks advice on suitable contraception methods that are safe during lactation and will not affect her milk supply. What is the most appropriate contraceptive method for this breastfeeding postpartum patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For breastfeeding mothers seeking effective and safe postpartum contraception, progestin-only contraceptives are an excellent choice. They provide reliable contraception without compromising breast milk production or the health of the infant.
  • ➤ For breastfeeding mothers seeking effective and safe postpartum contraception, progestin-only contraceptives are an excellent choice.
  • ➤ They provide reliable contraception without compromising breast milk production or the health of the infant.

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true regarding high-quality CPR for adults? Push hard (5-6cm depth) Push fast (100-120/min frequency) Allow for complete chest recoil Minimize interruptions in compressions ≤20 seconds Rotate compressor every 5 min. or earlier if fatigued
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 1,2,3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ High-quality CPR for adults requires all the specified techniques to ensure optimal outcomes. Compressing at a depth of 5-6 cm and a rate of 100-120 compressions per minute, allowing for complete chest recoil, minimizing interruptions in compressions to under 10 seconds, and avoiding excessive ventilation are all recommended practices to maximize the effectiveness of cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
  • ➤ High-quality CPR for adults requires all the specified techniques to ensure optimal outcomes.
  • ➤ Compressing at a depth of 5-6 cm and a rate of 100-120 compressions per minute, allowing for complete chest recoil, minimizing interruptions in compressions to under 10 seconds, and avoiding excessive ventilation are all recommended practices to maximize the effectiveness of cardiopulmonary resuscitation.

questions.text: A first-year obstetrics resident is performing her first cesarean section. The supervising surgeon is instructing her on identifying the lower uterine segment, crucial for making the surgical incision. What is the most reliable method for a first-year resident to identify the lower uterine segment during a cesarean section?

options.label: A
options.text: It lies under the loose uterovesical fold of peritoneum

options.label: B
options.text: It is where the presenting part can be palpated

options.label: C
options.text: It appears slightly more pink than the upper segment

options.label: D
options.text: It is just below the round ligaments

questions.correct_answer: A. It lies under the loose uterovesical fold of peritoneum
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The lower uterine segment is best identified by locating the uterovesical peritoneal fold during a cesarean section. Understanding and recognizing this anatomical feature are crucial for surgical accuracy and safety, reducing the risk of complications during the procedure.
  • ➤ The lower uterine segment is best identified by locating the uterovesical peritoneal fold during a cesarean section.
  • ➤ Understanding and recognizing this anatomical feature are crucial for surgical accuracy and safety, reducing the risk of complications during the procedure.

questions.text: Dr. Chandra, a senior policy advisor in the Health Ministry, is refining national biodefense strategies. She evaluates pathogens based on their classification into different categories of bioterrorism threats. Which of the following pathogens would Dr. Chandra prioritize for immediate preparedness measures due to its classification as a Category A bioterrorism threat?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Smallpox

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A 24-year-old male underwent ACL (anterior cruciate ligament) reconstruction surgery in the lithotomy position, with support at the popliteal fossae and proximal tibiae but not at the ankles. The day after surgery, he reported reduced sensation on the lateral side of his right leg and foot and had difficulty dorsiflexing his right foot. Given the postoperative symptoms of decreased lateral leg and foot sensation and dorsiflexion difficulty, which muscle innervated by the implicated nerve is likely affected?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The peroneal nerve, vulnerable to pressure near the fibular head during certain surgical positions, is crucial for foot dorsiflexion and lateral leg sensation. Its damage can lead to significant functional impairments, underscoring the importance of proper limb positioning during surgery to prevent such issues.
  • ➤ The peroneal nerve, vulnerable to pressure near the fibular head during certain surgical positions, is crucial for foot dorsiflexion and lateral leg sensation.
  • ➤ Its damage can lead to significant functional impairments, underscoring the importance of proper limb positioning during surgery to prevent such issues.

questions.text: During a reproductive biology seminar, a lecturer discusses the process of fertilization and the critical role of zona pellucida proteins in the regulation of sperm entry into the oocyte. One particular focus is on the zona hardening event that prevents polyspermy after the first sperm penetrates the oocyte. Which zona pellucida protein is primarily responsible for zona hardening after sperm penetration, thus preventing further sperm from entering the oocyte?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The role of ZP2 in zona hardening is crucial for insights into fertilization and the prevention of polyspermy. This knowledge is essential in the field of reproductive biology and can inform techniques used in assisted reproductive technology (ART).
  • ➤ The role of ZP2 in zona hardening is crucial for insights into fertilization and the prevention of polyspermy.
  • ➤ This knowledge is essential in the field of reproductive biology and can inform techniques used in assisted reproductive technology (ART).

questions.text: A forensic expert is called to examine skeletal remains found in an abandoned warehouse. The remains are largely intact, and determining the age of the individual is crucial for the ongoing investigation. The expert notes a key feature in the sternum to assist with age estimation. According to the observed rule, if the body of the sternum is longer and more than twice the length of the manubrium, the individual was likely an adult. Which rule is the forensic expert applying to assess the age of the skeletal remains?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Hyrtl's rule

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ According to Hyrtl’s law, manubrio corpus index or sternal index exceeds 50 in females and is less than 50 in males or the body is longer and more than the twice the length of the manubrium in males
  • ➤ According to Hyrtl’s law, manubrio corpus index or sternal index exceeds 50 in females and is less than 50 in males or the body is longer and more than the twice the length of the manubrium in males

questions.text: In a clinical seminar on reproductive endocrinology, the discussion focuses on the biochemical profiles characteristic of Stein-Leventhal syndrome, known as polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). A specialist outlines the typical hormonal imbalances and metabolic disruptions associated with the condition. Which of the following biochemical findings is NOT typical of Stein-Leventhal syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Elevation in the levels of sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG)

options.label: B
options.text: Marked elevation of LH in contrast to FSH

questions.correct_answer: A. Elevation in the levels of sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of Stein-Leventhal syndrome, biochemical features include elevated LH relative to FSH, insulin resistance, and increased plasma testosterone levels. Contrary to some disorders that increase SHBG, PCOS is associated with decreased SHBG levels, which affects the bioavailability of sex hormones and exacerbates symptoms.
  • ➤ In cases of Stein-Leventhal syndrome, biochemical features include elevated LH relative to FSH, insulin resistance, and increased plasma testosterone levels.
  • ➤ Contrary to some disorders that increase SHBG, PCOS is associated with decreased SHBG levels, which affects the bioavailability of sex hormones and exacerbates symptoms.

questions.text: Match the following surgical instruments with the surgeries for which they are typically used: Instruments: Surgeries: ​​​​​​​
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A4, B3, C1, D2

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • A4: Mollison Mastoid Retractor used during Mastoidectomy - This retractor is used to provide visibility and access during mastoid surgeries, correctly matching with 4) Mastoidectomy.
  • • A4: Mollison Mastoid Retractor used during Mastoidectomy
  • • B3: Dennis Browne Tonsil Holding Forceps used during Tonsillectomy - These forceps are specialized for grasping and manipulating the tonsils during extraction, properly paired with 3) Tonsillectomy.
  • • B3: Dennis Browne Tonsil Holding Forceps used during Tonsillectomy
  • • C1: Freer Elevator used during Septoplasty - The Freer Elevator is utilized to delicately separate mucosal tissues from the cartilage during nasal septum surgeries, aligning with 1) Septoplasty.
  • • C1: Freer Elevator used during Septoplasty
  • • D2: Tracheal Dilator used during Tracheostomy - This dilator assists in opening the trachea to facilitate the insertion of a tracheostomy tube, matching with 2) Tracheostomy.
  • • D2: Tracheal Dilator used during Tracheostomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Learn to correctly identify and match the Mollison Mastoid Retractor with Mastoidectomy, Dennis Browne Tonsil Holding Forceps with Tonsillectomy, Freer Elevator with Septoplasty, and Tracheal Dilator with Tracheostomy.
  • ➤ Learn to correctly identify and match the Mollison Mastoid Retractor with Mastoidectomy, Dennis Browne Tonsil Holding Forceps with Tonsillectomy, Freer Elevator with Septoplasty, and Tracheal Dilator with Tracheostomy.

questions.text: A 40-year-old male is brought to a tertiary care hospital in Pune for a routine health checkup due to his history of intravenous drug use. He appears well and reports no symptoms. Blood tests reveal abnormal liver enzyme levels, and subsequent testing confirms an active hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection. Despite the presence of high titers of IgG antibodies against the HCV envelope protein, his viral load remains high, indicating ongoing viral replication. What could be the most likely reason that these antibodies are unable to clear the virus from his system?

options.label: A
options.text: Antigenic drift in HCV envelope proteins

options.label: B
options.text: Immune complex formation with HCV envelope proteins

options.label: C
options.text: Poor B-cell response to HCV envelope proteins

options.label: D
options.text: Non-neutralizing nature of the antibodies against HCV envelope proteins

questions.correct_answer: D. Non-neutralizing nature of the antibodies against HCV envelope proteins
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Non-neutralizing nature of the antibodies against HCV envelope proteins

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of high titers of IgG antibodies against Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) envelope proteins does not guarantee effective immunity, especially if these antibodies lack neutralizing capabilities.
  • ➤ The presence of high titers of IgG antibodies against Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) envelope proteins does not guarantee effective immunity, especially if these antibodies lack neutralizing capabilities.

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman with a history of irregular menstrual cycles and recurrent miscarriages is referred for to evaluate for potential congenital Müllerian anomalies. What is the preferred imaging modality for diagnosing congenital Müllerian anomalies?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ MRI is the imaging modality of choice for diagnosing congenital Müllerian anomalies due to its ability to provide detailed, high-resolution images of the uterine and adjacent pelvic anatomy without the risks associated with ionizing radiation.
  • ➤ MRI is the imaging modality of choice for diagnosing congenital Müllerian anomalies due to its ability to provide detailed, high-resolution images of the uterine and adjacent pelvic anatomy without the risks associated with ionizing radiation.

questions.text: Based on the life cycle depicted, which organism is most likely responsible?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Leptospirosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Leptospirosis –
  • ➤ Leptospirosis results from a mild febrile illness to severe fatal disease with liver/kidney involvement. Route of transmission is direct skin contact with infected rat’s urine Occupational exposure at risk: Agricultural and lives tock farmers (rice fields, sugarcane fields, underground sewers, abattoir workers, meat/animal handlers, veterinarians)
  • ➤ Leptospirosis results from a mild febrile illness to severe fatal disease with liver/kidney involvement.
  • ➤ Route of transmission is direct skin contact with infected rat’s urine
  • ➤ Occupational exposure at risk: Agricultural and lives tock farmers (rice fields, sugarcane fields, underground sewers, abattoir workers, meat/animal handlers, veterinarians)

questions.text: Dr. Varma, a public health officer, is tasked with improving the efficiency of healthcare services in a rural community clinic. As part of his efforts, he decides to implement a method to observe and record the activities of the healthcare staff at predetermined or random intervals to assess their work patterns and identify areas for improvement. Which of the following best describes the method he is using?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Work sampling

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Work Sampling: Systematic observation and recording of activities of one or more individuals, carried out at pre-determined or random intervals.
  • ➤ Work Sampling: Systematic observation and recording of activities of one or more individuals, carried out at pre-determined or random intervals.
  • ➤ It provides quantitative measurement of various activities.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents to the psychiatric clinic reporting a belief that different people he encounters throughout the day are actually the same individual who changes appearance. He describes feeling tracked and harassed by this person and exhibits significant distress while recounting his experiences. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Fregoli Syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Delusional misidentification syndromes include Capgras syndrome, Fregoli’s syndrome, syndrome of intermetamorphosis and syndrome of subjective doubles.
  • ➤ Delusional misidentification syndromes include Capgras syndrome, Fregoli’s syndrome, syndrome of intermetamorphosis and syndrome of subjective doubles.

References:

  • ↳ Reference: Sim’s Symptoms in the Mind, 7th edition, Page No 124-125.

questions.text: A 3-week-old infant presents with persistent jaundice, pale stools, and hepatomegaly. The infant's bilirubin levels are predominantly conjugated. An ultrasound of the liver is performed and the image is given below. Based on this finding, which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The triangular cord sign on ultrasound is highly indicative of biliary atresia in infants presenting with conjugated hyperbilirubinemia, clay coloured stools, and hepatomegaly. This finding is crucial for early diagnosis and management, as timely surgical intervention (Kasai procedure) can improve bile flow and liver function in affected infants.
  • ➤ The triangular cord sign on ultrasound is highly indicative of biliary atresia in infants presenting with conjugated hyperbilirubinemia, clay coloured stools, and hepatomegaly.
  • ➤ This finding is crucial for early diagnosis and management, as timely surgical intervention (Kasai procedure) can improve bile flow and liver function in affected infants.

questions.text: In a neuroanatomy session, medical students are discussing the venous structures related to the cavernous sinus using a cranial base illustration. The instructor focuses on understanding the venous drainage into the cavernous sinus. Based on the provided image, which vein does NOT drain into the pinned structure?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The drainage pattern into the cavernous sinus is crucial in the clinical context, especially for conditions involving venous circulation within the brain, such as thrombosis or spread of infections from facial veins to intracranial structures.
  • ➤ The drainage pattern into the cavernous sinus is crucial in the clinical context, especially for conditions involving venous circulation within the brain, such as thrombosis or spread of infections from facial veins to intracranial structures.

questions.text: Dr. Sharma is tasked with implementing a health education program to improve maternal health awareness in his district. He decides to use a model of health education that focuses on fostering a deep personal connection and belief in the health practices being promoted, to ensure that the community members not only understand but also internalize these health messages. Which model of health education is most appropriate for achieving 'internalization' of health education messages in this context?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Motivation model

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Motivation Model of Health education (Adoption Model)
  • ➤ Three stages in process of behavioural change: Awareness: Interest Motivation: Evaluation, Decision-making Action: Adoption, Acceptance Internalization: New idea/acquired behavior becomes part of own existing values
  • ➤ Three stages in process of behavioural change: Awareness: Interest Motivation: Evaluation, Decision-making Action: Adoption, Acceptance
  • ➤ Awareness: Interest Motivation: Evaluation, Decision-making Action: Adoption, Acceptance
  • ➤ Awareness: Interest
  • ➤ Motivation: Evaluation, Decision-making
  • ➤ Action: Adoption, Acceptance
  • ➤ Internalization: New idea/acquired behavior becomes part of own existing values

questions.text: A 6-year-old child presents to the pediatric clinic with a history of seizures. Concerned about potential neurological involvement, the pediatrician orders a CT scan of the head and image is provided below. Based on the radiological findings and clinical presentation, which of the following conditions is most likely associated with the appearance on this child’s CT scan?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of "tram-track" calcifications in a CT scan, especially when associated with a facial port-wine stain and neurological symptoms such as seizures, is highly indicative of Sturge-Weber syndrome.
  • ➤ The presence of "tram-track" calcifications in a CT scan, especially when associated with a facial port-wine stain and neurological symptoms such as seizures, is highly indicative of Sturge-Weber syndrome.

questions.text: In the aftermath of a severe earthquake in a densely populated region, local authorities decided to revise building regulations to enhance structural resilience against future seismic events. New guidelines now require that all new constructions must incorporate advanced earthquake-resistant technologies. This change is aimed at reducing the damage and enhancing safety during potential future earthquakes. Which step of disaster management does this initiative best exemplify?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Disaster mitigation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Stages of a Disaster Cycle
  • ➤ Stages of a Disaster Cycle

questions.text: During a neurology lecture, medical students are examining a diagram depicting a transverse section of the upper medulla. The professor uses this image to explain the structure and function of various nuclei and their connections. Which statement is NOT true about the depicted transverse section of the upper medulla in the image?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a transverse section of the upper medulla.

options.label: B
options.text: The structure indicated by the arrow is the inferior olivary nucleus.

options.label: C
options.text: Efferents from the inferior olivary nucleus form the parolivocerebellar fibers.

options.label: D
options.text: The efferents from the inferior olivary nucleus reach the cerebellum through the inferior cerebellar peduncle.

questions.correct_answer: C. Efferents from the inferior olivary nucleus form the parolivocerebellar fibers.
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The inferior olivary nucleus plays a crucial role in the coordination of movements through its projections to the cerebellum via climbing fibers, emphasizing the importance of understanding these connections for clinical assessments of motor function and coordination disorders.
  • ➤ The inferior olivary nucleus plays a crucial role in the coordination of movements through its projections to the cerebellum via climbing fibers, emphasizing the importance of understanding these connections for clinical assessments of motor function and coordination disorders.

questions.text: Which amino acid is involved in collagen synthesis and does not require aminoacyl t-RNA for its incorporation into a protein?
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Unlike other amino acids involved in protein synthesis, hydroxyproline is not directly encoded by DNA nor initially synthesized via aminoacyl t-RNA. Instead, it is formed by modifying proline residues already incorporated into collagen, highlighting a unique aspect of collagen synthesis and stability. This post-translational modification is critical for the mechanical stability of collagen fibers.
  • ➤ Unlike other amino acids involved in protein synthesis, hydroxyproline is not directly encoded by DNA nor initially synthesized via aminoacyl t-RNA.
  • ➤ Instead, it is formed by modifying proline residues already incorporated into collagen, highlighting a unique aspect of collagen synthesis and stability.
  • ➤ This post-translational modification is critical for the mechanical stability of collagen fibers.

questions.text: A 60-year-old male presented with a cancerous growth on his face. A diagnosis of Basal Cell Carcinoma is made based on biopsy findings which showed characteristic peripheral palisading of tumor cells. Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Nodular type is the commonest clinical presentation in this condition

options.label: B
options.text: PUVA therapy is a risk factor for this condition

options.label: C
options.text: Early diagnosis in Pre-malignant stage is crucial for the prognosis of this condition

questions.correct_answer: C. Early diagnosis in Pre-malignant stage is crucial for the prognosis of this condition
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Basal cell carcinoma is a skin cancer with a high cure rate when detected early and treated appropriately. While it typically presents as a nodular growth and rarely metastasizes, it does not progress through a pre-malignant stage, distinguishing it from some other types of skin cancers. Early diagnosis and treatment are essential to prevent extensive local damage rather than due to concerns about distant metastasis or progression from a pre-malignant phase.
  • ➤ Basal cell carcinoma is a skin cancer with a high cure rate when detected early and treated appropriately.
  • ➤ While it typically presents as a nodular growth and rarely metastasizes, it does not progress through a pre-malignant stage, distinguishing it from some other types of skin cancers.
  • ➤ Early diagnosis and treatment are essential to prevent extensive local damage rather than due to concerns about distant metastasis or progression from a pre-malignant phase.
